en.title: FE Making Waves In Philippines! (1)
en.content:
FE's Founder CEO Paul Ting was in Manila, Philippines recently and attended Presidential Director Pastor Arthur Medina's Leadership Training Program held at Club Filipino, Manila on Saturday 01st August 2009. The training program, from 10am - 4pm was attended by around 200 enthusiastic and dynamic FE leaders, some of whom came from as far as Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao. Among the attendees were FE's Philippines Country Licensee Jeremy Looi, Tony Katingbak (California, USA State Licensee). Danny Co ( New Jersey, USA State Licensee), and PDs Marlene Medina, Pastor Dave Trinidad, Kap Eli Demafelis and Art and Grace Tuason. Also attending were FE Leaders General Cabusao, Pastor Steve Mirpuri and Drs Stewart and Corrie De Boer and Erik Tai ( TV host and Philippines Rugby Team player).

In his speech Paul expounded on FE's Vision, Direction and Blue Ocean Strategies, and in his usual from the heart and open stye, left no stones uncovered. Paul also briefed the audience on the launch of FE's "Hope For Children" Charity, a global social entrepreneur initiative that will propel FE to the forefront of growth and recognition in the world. The audience was completely satisfied and convinced that FE is the vehicle of choice for all of them to achieve their own personal goals.

During the inverval, the audience was entertained by child prodigy, 9 year old singer Clark Gamul who moved the audience with his touching rendition of Michael Jackson's song "Ben" and a medley of Neil Sedaka songs. Clark Gamul is a result from the Philippines Centre For Arts Foundation, an NGO set up to train and nurture talented and gifted children from poor families in the performing arts. Also singing at the event was the Chairman of Centre For Arts Foundation, Jerome Vinarao and jazz singer Stella Ignacio from the Centre For Arts Foundation. FE's "Hope For Children" looks forward to working closely with Centre For Arts Foundation and give talented and gifted children from poor families, such as Clark Gamul, a chance and a future in the performing arts.

A BIG THANK YOU to PD Pastor Art and Team for yet another very successful event ! Your tireless work and committment is finally paying off with your network now growing exponentially all over the world ! Congratulations !  AHOO! AHOO!! AHOO!!!
< Click here for more photos >
